meaningMnemonic: You're making things in two different places be exactly the <kanji>same</kanji> for <kanji>a period of time</kanji>. You're in the <kanji>middle</kanji> of a process called <vocabulary>syncing</vocabulary>. You can see 同期中 a lot in computery contexts, or if you change your device language to Japanese. (Not that I recommend that...)
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
